hey everyone welcome to Pai's kitchen today I want

trust me these are actually delicious and what

this will be a perfect gift idea so let's get 
started the easiest part of this recipe is the

making of the batter which is what we're gonna 
do first so we're gonna start out with just an

egg whites I'm gonna get this feed up until it's 
frothy so you don't need a meringue or anything

you just need frothy egg whites oh no big bubbles 
nice and fine like this and then I'm gonna add

some caster sugar or superfine sugar and some 
places in the world can get caster sugar but if

you don't have caster sugar you can just do what 
I did basically take the sugar put it in a coffee

grinder or blender it comes out very very fine and 
that's just gonna ensure that the sugar dissolves

very quickly and our batter is very smooth all 
right so just get into it's smooth and it'll

become glossy and shiny our seasoning seasoning 
flavoring so I'm gonna go in with just standard

vanilla but you can do whatever you want you can 
make these almond flavored so it's a really bad

idea to be measuring this over your bowl because 
if you spill then it all goes through the bowl

so don't do what I just did you can do lemon zest 
I've done that too orange zest for orange flavor

so really whatever flavor you like your cookies to 
be a little pinch of salt always salt in desserts

just a little pinch give that a quick mix mix 
together I'm gonna go in with some flour this

is just all-purpose flour dump it in and whisk it 
until it's smooth and combined yeah the batter is

a dump and stir which I love okay so now that it's 
smooth you're gonna Cerne some melted butter and

this is the reason why these cookies are going 
to taste much better than the ones that you get

a Chinese restaurants and just stir that in until 
it's smooth and well incorporated and that's it

that is your fortune cookie batter so this is the

you'll need in order to help me make nice rounds

I put a parchment paper that I drew a pattern 
on it and this is just a four inch circle they

basically walked around the house and look for 
round things it was roughly the right size I'm

gonna use this silicon mat it's called a Silpat 
it's just a silicone baking sheet nothing sticks

to this so these cookies are sticky so you 
definitely want to have this or you can also

try if you have a nonstick cookie sheet I would 
grease it as well you can use that some people

like to use parchment paper if you don't have 
anything else parchment paper will work but I

do find that once the wet batter goes on the

bit and it doesn't create as nice of a cookie 
but you know it'll work and because the way I

rolled this when I stored it it just kind of does

don't fill it up all the way and smear it around

now and then my offset spatula is what's gonna

now what you don't want to do is make the edge 
thinner than the middle because it's going to

start browning from the edges and if you make 
the edge thinner than the middle then it'll burn

before the middle will have a chance to cook 
I would do more than three at a time because

when you shade these they have to stay hot so

to crisp as they cool however if after they're

completely cool and they're still not crispy 
which could happen for a couple of reasons one

your batter is too thick which usually it's the 
center that's not crispy or the oven was too hot

and so it browned on the outside too quickly and 
it didn't have time to dry out so that happens

don't panic you can put them back in the oven 
275 for about 7 to 10 minutes and that'll dry

it up and at 275 they won't Brown any further 
they will unfold when you heat them up again

so you just have to reform them when they come
